title: Why is Gmail unstable on Firefox?
content:
For two days now Gmail has been unstable on Firefox. It keeps displaying this message: "Oops - The system encountered a problem (#001)".

While in that state, the send messages folder is empty, and I can't attach documents to an email.

Google suggests clearing the browser cache and cookies. Don't want to do that - much work required to recover.
creator: john.williams.now

title: Facebook won't allow video or voice calls anymore, since introducing End-To-End Encryption (E2EE), specifically only on Firefox
content: Ever since Facebook started infesting the chats with end-to-end encryption (random chats get "Messenger upgraded the security of this chat. Messages and calls are secured with end-to-end encryption" without my permission or asking if I want this), any encrypted chats have audio and video calls disabled. I note that I have ONE friend for whom it didn't do this, I can still do calls with her. If I receive a call, I get a pop-up saying that to receive this call I must download the Messenger app (no way) or a browser which supports it. If I check what browsers it thinks supports this, it only lists Chrome and Edge. As far as I know Edge is just Internet Explorer renamed, the biggest black hole in security, I've never touched it. Chrome ignores industry standards, so I don't use it. Making Firefox the best, top browser available. It's the only browser I wish to use. Mozilla needs to look into how to get Facebook to stop blacklisting Firefox like this. Note that this E2EE garbage has only been infecting things for the last few months, before that I was perfectly able to do any calls I wished in Facebook Messenger.
creator: niceguy1_

content:

title: Website Not Loading in Mozilla Firefox but Works in Other Browsers
content:
Hello Mozilla community,

I'm encountering a perplexing issue with Mozilla Firefox that I hope someone here can help me with. Whenever I set Mozilla Firefox as my default browser, I experience difficulties accessing my website. The site continuously buffers but never fully loads, leaving me unable to view its content when i click on (How I Sleep at Night Knowing I’m Failing All My Cl – Tymoff).

However, when I switch to a different browser as my default, such as Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge, the website loads without any issues. This leads me to believe that the problem might be specific to Mozilla Firefox.

I've tried troubleshooting by clearing the browser cache, disabling extensions, and even reinstalling Firefox, but the problem persists. I've also checked for any errors in the browser console, but nothing seems out of the ordinary.

Could there be any compatibility issues between my website and Mozilla Firefox that are causing this problem? Or is there something else I should investigate to resolve this issue?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance for your assistance!

content:
Hi All,

I'm using Firefox on 24 PC's in a primary school computer Lab, I have had reports of students installing extensions and plugins that i wish to stop, also i've had issues with students not signing out of their email and other students gaining access.

Im looking for solutions for the following and was hoping someone could point me in the right direction -

Any help would be greatly appreciated. Adam

title: Issues with Website Reloading on Firefox
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I'm experiencing an issue with my website, https://letmewatchthiss.com/, specifically on the Firefox browser. While the site functions correctly across other browsers, it's not reloading properly in Firefox.

Issue Description: Website URL: https://letmewatchthiss.com/ Problem: The site reloads inconsistently or fails to load entirely on Firefox. Affected Browsers: Firefox (issue does not appear in Chrome, Edge, or Safari).

Steps Taken:

  • Cleared Firefox cache and cookies.
  • Checked for any extensions that might be causing conflicts.
  • Verified that the issue persists across multiple devices running Firefox.

What I Need Help With:

Suggestions: Any advice on potential fixes or troubleshooting steps specific to Firefox. Insights: If there are known issues or recent updates that might be affecting Firefox compatibility. Any help or insights would be greatly appreciated. Thank you!

Best regards,

title: why doesn't firefox update its address bar immediately when opening slow web sites
content:
When you navigate to a web site which is slow to respond the address bar keeps showing the previous address until the web page loads or a network error occurs. It may take minutes. It happens for instance when clicking a a web search result or when the site itself redirects to another web page.

This Firefox behavior is there for years and I even remember that Internet Explorer had the same behavior during its era.

Is there any particular reason to do that? Because I only see downsides: for instance, you can't copy the URL to check in another program or device.

Somebody might argue that it's because you can press Esc during load and stay on the previous page. I think it would be more convenient to revert the address bar value when this happens.

title: FireFox no longer displays images off-line
content:
Dear FireFox,

Christian greetings in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

I wrote you last night requesting assistance. My FireFox does not display images off-Line.

Today I received the following pop up Message:

"Some pictures have been blocked to help present the sender from identifying your computer. Open this item to view the pictures".

Done that and it makes no difference. I am a Christian Minister with nothing to hide. Our Church computer contains the material listen on our Church Website.

This a recent difficulty. Please assist.

Please visit www.http://biblebelievers.au/nl1297.htm or any of almost 2,000 other teaching sermons, Newsletters, ebooks or other files with images. They ALL display with FireFox on-line but NOT off-line, however thew will display off-line on Edge and Google Chrome.

Today I received a pop-up notice stating:

"Some pictures have been blocked to help prevent the sender from identifying your computer. Open this item to view the pictures."

It STILL blocks the images. I, ME, and MYSELF need to view the images as I write and code the pages.

There is NOTHING wrong with the images, it id FireFox that is causing the problem on non-display off-line. I have the latest FireFox, It has ALWAYS displayed images off-line because ALL of the images are on the Church Website. And yes, I use WIN 10 O/S. AND Microsoft Defender Software visits the Church computer every day-or-so.

May God bless you for assisting me.

Yours sincerely in the love and service of our Lord Jesus Christ.

Your brother-in-Christ, Anthony Grigor-Scott MINISTER OF THE GOSPEL http://www.biblebelievers.au/ Subscribe to Bible Believers' FREE Weekly Church Newsletter

title: Freezing and Stuttering when one tab is generating lots of text
content:
I have a server that runs my minecraft server, and if the console of that is open and needs to generate a bunch of text for the logs in my browser, it ends up freezing my browser for sometimes a few moments and sometimes 30 seconds or more. It stops be from being able to interact with firefox at all.

Is especially weird because nothing on my computer is being maxed out, my Ryzen 5 5600G isnt above 15% usage, my ram of 48GB is only sitting at around 20Gb usage, and my Radeon RX 7600XT GPU with 16GB of VRAM isnt anywhere near even 50% usage. I have Use recommended performance settings turned on in firefoxs settings.

This install of windows is also only about one month old

I cannot fathom what could be causing such a severe and drastic drop in performance and useablility
